definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The feedback will become so strong it destroys the wormhole.
sentences.chinese: 反饋變得很強大而毀壞了蟲洞。

sentences.english: Spirited debates have erupted between physicists concerning these wormholes.
sentences.chinese: 之間爆發了熱烈的爭論，就這些蟲洞物理學家。
那麼蟲洞旅行是否可靠呢？

sentences.english: The same thing will happen with a wormhole, only with radiation instead of sound.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的理論可以解釋蟲洞的存在，只是射線取代聲音。

sentences.english: It then release its power, forming another "worm hole", the door of time had been opened.
sentences.chinese: 當能量釋放完全後，蟲洞停止噴發，時空之門關閉。

sentences.english: The wormhole-like mesoporous tungsten oxide exhibits outstanding sensitivity and reproduction in photochromic properties.
sentences.chinese: 蟲洞狀介孔氧化鎢之光致色變效應顯著並具再現性。

sentences.english: When energy release after completely, worm hole stop eruption, the time and space closes.
sentences.chinese: 當能量釋放完全後，蟲洞停止噴發，時空之門關閉。

sentences.english: Electromagnetic wormholes could have many applications.
sentences.chinese: “電磁蟲洞”技術可以有許多應用。

sentences.english: Could wormholes hold the secret to faster-than-light travel?
sentences.chinese: 蟲洞是否包含了超光速旅途的奧祕？

sentences.english: Capture the building and Retreat back through the Wormhole with your Mastermind.
sentences.chinese: 佔領建築然後讓攝魂師通過蟲洞撤回來。

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
the road back to where one came from
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
